alert.note: Alert for Hartley; Moore; Oldham; Potter (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:16AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Oldham, Potter, southern Moore and southeastern Hartley Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 116 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Valley De Oro, or 24 miles northeast of Vega, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Channing, Boys Ranch, Masterson, Valley De Oro and Lake Meredith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Meredith, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
